facelet-taglib.description: The Liferay Faces Alloy facelet component tags with the alloy: tag name prefix.

function.description: Returns an escaped representation of the specified client ID.
Returns the client ID associated with the specified expression.

attribute.description: The character encoding of the resource linked to by this component.
attribute.name: charset

attribute.description: The position and shape of the component's area on the page. Used in image maps.
attribute.name: coords

attribute.description: The language code of the resource linked to by this component.
attribute.name: hreflang

attribute.description: The relationship between the current document and the one linked to by this component. This is a space-separated list of link types. Used by bots, not browsers.
attribute.name: rel

attribute.description: The reverse of the rel attribute. The relationship between the document linked to by this component and the current document.
attribute.name: rev

attribute.description: Used by some browsers with the coords to specify the size, shape, and placement of the link.
attribute.name: shape

attribute.description: Specifies which window, tab, or frame to open the link in.
attribute.name: target

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the content type of resource located by the URL in the rendered href attribute.
attribute.name: type

attribute.description: Space-delimited list of component ids that are to participate in the APPLY_REQUEST_VALUES, PROCESS_VALIDATIONS, UPDATE_MODEL_VALUES, and INVOKE_APPLICATION phases of the JSF lifecycle. The following keywords may also appear in the list: @this, @form, @all, @none.
attribute.name: execute

attribute.description: Space-delimited list of component ids that are to participate in the RENDER_RESPONSE phase of the JSF lifecycle and be re-rendered in the DOM after the response is received from the XmlHttpRequest. The following keywords may also appear in the list: @this, @form, @all, @none.
attribute.name: render

attribute.description: When this flag is true, clicking on the button will cause the form to be submitted via XmlHttpRequest.
attribute.name: ajax

attribute.description: Synonym for the execute attribute. The default value is "@all".
attribute.name: process

attribute.description: Synonym for the render attribute. The default value is "@none".
attribute.name: update

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying whether or not the component should automatically recieve focus on the initial page load.
attribute.name: autofocus

attribute.description: When this flag is true, the component will be disabled, and the user will be unable to interact with the component.
attribute.name: disabled

attribute.description: Specifies the URL of an image.
attribute.name: image

attribute.description: List of CSS class names (separated by spaces) that are to be rendered within the class attribute.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description: The value of this component.
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: The height of the dialog/popover.
attribute.name: height

attribute.description: When true, an "x" is placed in the upper right corner that the user can click on to hide/dismiss the overlay window.
attribute.name: hideIconRendered

attribute.description: The width of the dialog/popover.
attribute.name: width

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the XML namespace used in the element. Note: In a portlet evironment, this attribute will not be written.
attribute.name: xmlns

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the maximum length of characters allowed in the element.
attribute.name: maxlength

attribute.description: When true, the component will render an HTML5 <input type="date" /> element on small/mobile displays in order to enable selection of a date with the mobile device's native UI.
attribute.name: nativeWhenMobile

attribute.description: CSS class name that is to be appended to the value of the rendered class attribute when the severity of a FacesMessage is FacesMessage.Severity.ERROR.
attribute.name: errorClass

attribute.description: CSS style that is to be appended to the value of the rendered style attribute when the severity of a FacesMessage is FacesMessage.Severity.ERROR.
attribute.name: errorStyle

attribute.description: CSS class name that is to be appended to the value of the rendered class attribute when the severity of a FacesMessage is FacesMessage.Severity.FATAL.
attribute.name: fatalClass

attribute.description: CSS style that is to be appended to the value of the rendered style attribute when the severity of a FacesMessage is FacesMessage.Severity.FATAL.
attribute.name: fatalStyle

attribute.description: CSS class name that is to be appended to the value of the rendered class attribute when the severity of a FacesMessage is FacesMessage.Severity.INFO.
attribute.name: infoClass

attribute.description: CSS style that is to be appended to the value of the rendered style attribute when the severity of a FacesMessage is FacesMessage.Severity.INFO.
attribute.name: infoStyle

attribute.description: When true, the value of FacesMessage.getDetail() is rendered. The default value is true.
attribute.name: showDetail

attribute.description: When true, the value of FacesMessage.getSummary() is rendered. The default value is true.
attribute.name: showSummary

attribute.description: When true, the value of FacesMessage.getDetail() rendered as a tooltip. The default value is true.
attribute.name: tooltip

attribute.description: CSS class name that is to be appended to the value of the rendered class attribute when the severity of a FacesMessage is FacesMessage.Severity.WARN.
attribute.name: warnClass

attribute.description: CSS style that is to be appended to the value of the rendered style attribute when the severity of a FacesMessage is FacesMessage.Severity.WARN.
attribute.name: warnStyle

attribute.description: Indicates the side of the associated component where the tooltip should appear ("right", "left", "top", "bottom").
attribute.name: position

attribute.description: When true, the component is visible initially.
attribute.name: autoShow

attribute.description: The text to place in the header of the component.
attribute.name: headerText

attribute.description: Specifies the stack order of the component. The default value is a constant from the Liferay.zIndex JavaScript object.
attribute.name: zIndex

attribute.description: The name of the library which contains the resource.
attribute.name: library

attribute.description: The name of the resource file to be included on the page.
attribute.name: name

tag.description: Accordion is a UIData (iterator) component that renders child tabs either statically or dynamically.

attribute.description: When true, expanding an item will not collapse the others, allowing multiple items to be visible at the same time.
attribute.name: multiple

attribute.description: Integer representing the zero-based index representing the selected tab.
attribute.name: selectedIndex

tag.description: Audio is a UIComponent that renders a <div> that contains an HTML5 <audio> element. It also supports graceful degradation for older browsers.

attribute.description: HTML5 passthrough attribute specifying the initial volume of the player.
attribute.name: volume

tag.description: AutoComplete is a UIInput component that renders an <input> element and a popup list. Suggestions (list items) can be added by specifying f:selectItem or f:selectItems tags as children. Since it extends HtmlInputText, it supports all the features of h:inputText.

attribute.description: When true, the first item in the list will be activated so that users can press TAB or ENTER to select it.
attribute.name: activateFirstItem

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying whether autocomplete is turned on or off for the rendered HTML element. Valid values include off (default) and on.
attribute.name: autocomplete

attribute.description: When true, if the active option of the autoComplete is not in view, the view will be scrolled to ensure that the active option is displayed to the user.
attribute.name: autoScroll

attribute.description: When true, the autoComplete list will wrap around allowing users to use keyboard navigation to move from the top of the list to the bottom and vice versa. The default value is true.
attribute.name: circular

attribute.description: A callback which filters the client-side results. The callback must be a function which takes query and source arguments and returns an array of Strings as a result. The source argument recieved by this callback is an Array of Objects which contain three properties: display, raw, and text. Note: This attribute will be ignored if the serverCustomFilter or serverFilterType attributes are used.
attribute.name: clientCustomFilter

attribute.description:
Specifies the type of filter that will be used for the autoComplete results. Valid values include:
  • charMatch
  • charMatchCase
  • phraseMatch
  • phraseMatchCase
  • startsWith
  • startsWithCase
  • subWordMatch
  • subWordMatchCase
  • wordMatch
  • wordMatchCase
Note: This attribute will be ignored if the serverCustomFilter, serverFilterType, or clientCustomFilter attributes are used.
attribute.name: clientFilterType

attribute.description: The delay in milliseconds before a request for filtering occurs. After the autoComplete receives input, it waits the specified number of milliseconds before sending a request for filtering it's source. If input occurs before the specified number of milliseconds has elapsed, the timer is reset.
attribute.name: delay

attribute.description: The string which delimits the part of the text that will have completion. For example, if delimiter=" ", then only the text after the final space will have completion. Note: if listItemRequired="true", this attribute is ignored.
attribute.name: delimiter

attribute.description: The the height (in pixels) of the rendered autoComplete list.
attribute.name: height

attribute.description:
Specifies the type of highlighter that will be used for the autoComplete results. Valid values include:
  • charMatch
  • charMatchCase
  • phraseMatch
  • phraseMatchCase
  • startsWith
  • startsWithCase
  • subWordMatch
  • subWordMatchCase
  • wordMatch
  • wordMatchCase
attribute.name: highlighterType

attribute.description: When true, the component will perform server-side validation to ensure that the value entered is on the list of completion items.
attribute.name: listItemRequired

attribute.description: The maximum amount of autoComplete results.
attribute.name: maxItems

attribute.description: The minimum length of input required to trigger a query.
attribute.name: minChars

attribute.description: A method that is executed when a query occurs. The method must be public, return a java.util.List<java.lang.String>, and takes a java.lang.String and a java.util.List<java.lang.String> as a arguments. The String passed to the method is the current query. The List<String> is an immutable list of unfiltered results. The method must return a List<String> which contains the filtered results.
attribute.name: serverCustomFilter

attribute.description:
Specifies the type of filter that will be used for the autoComplete results. Valid values include:
  • charMatch
  • charMatchCase
  • phraseMatch
  • phraseMatchCase
  • startsWith
  • startsWithCase
  • subWordMatch
  • subWordMatchCase
  • wordMatch
  • wordMatchCase
Note: This attribute will be ignored if the serverCustomFilter attribute is used.
attribute.name: serverFilterType

attribute.description: When true, pressing TAB selects the active autoComplete option.
attribute.name: tabSelect

attribute.description: The the width (in pixels) of the rendered autoComplete list.
attribute.name: width

tag.description: Body is a UIOutput that renders a <body> element for webapps and a <div> for portlets. Since it extends HtmlBody, it supports all the features of h:body.

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a load event occurs. Note: In a portlet evironment, this attribute will not be written.
attribute.name: onload

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a unload event occurs. Note: In a portlet evironment, this attribute will not be written.
attribute.name: onunload

tag.description: Button is a UIOutput component that renders a styleable HTML <button> element. The default type is button. Since it extends HtmlOutcomeTargetButton it supports all the features of h:button. The component does not need to be a child of h:form since the outcome attribute is designed to navigate via HTTP GET.

attribute.description: The type of the button: button (default), submit, or reset.
attribute.name: type

tag.description: ButtonRow is a UIPanel component that renders a <div> element for grouping purposes. Since it extends HtmlPanelGroup, it supports all the features of h:panelGroup.
Column is a UIColumn component that renders a div with CSS class name col-#{size}-#{span} (for example: col-md-1 or col-lg-5).

attribute.description: Space-delimited list of component ids that are to participate in the APPLY_REQUEST_VALUES, PROCESS_VALIDATIONS, UPDATE_MODEL_VALUES, and INVOKE_APPLICATION phases of the JSF lifecycle. The following keywords may also appear in the list: @this, @form, @all, @none, @parent. The default value is @parent (meaning, the parent alloy:dataTable).
attribute.name: execute

attribute.description: When alloy:column is a child of alloy:dataTabe, this is the JavaBean property that is to be used for filtering.
attribute.name: filterBy

attribute.description: When alloy:column is a child of alloy:dataTable, this is the name of the CSS class that is to be rendered within the class attribute of the table's <td> element inside the <tfoot> element.
attribute.name: footerClass

attribute.description: When alloy:column is a child of alloy:dataTable, this is the name of the CSS class that is to be rendered within the class attribute of the table's <th> element inside the <thead> element.
attribute.name: headerClass

attribute.description: When alloy:column is a child of alloy:dataTable, this is the text for the column header. This attribute can be used as a convenience instead of specifying a child <f:facet name="header" /> tag.
attribute.name: headerText

attribute.description: When alloy:column is a child of alloy:row, this is the width that the column will be offset by as a unit from 1 to 12. This value is rendered as a CSS class as col-#{size}-offset-#{offset} (for example if offset="4", the CSS class rendered will be col-#{size}-offset-4). If both the offsetWidth and offset attributes are present, the offsetWidth attribute determines the value of the offset. Please consider using offsetWidth.
attribute.name: offset

attribute.description: When alloy:column is a child of alloy:row, this is the width that the column will be offset by as a percent. This value selects the offset via the formula offset = (offsetWidth/100)*12 (rounded to the nearest whole number). If both the offsetWidth and offset attributes are present, the offsetWidth attribute determines the value of the offset.
attribute.name: offsetWidth

attribute.description: Space-delimited list of component ids that are to participate in the RENDER_RESPONSE phase of the JSF lifecycle and be re-rendered in the DOM after the response is received from the XmlHttpRequest. The following keywords may also appear in the list: @this, @form, @all, @none, @parent. The default value is @parent (meaning, the parent alloy:dataTable).
attribute.name: render

attribute.description: When alloy:column is a child of alloy:row and this flag is true, then the column is to be rendered as a <th> element with scope=row.
attribute.name: rowHeader

attribute.description: When alloy:column is a child of alloy:row, this is the size of the column. This value is rendered as a CSS class as col-#{size}-#{span} (for example if size="medium", the CSS class rendered will be col-md-#{span}). Valid values include "extra-small" (or "xs"), "small" (or "sm"), "medium" (or "md"), and "large" (or "lg").
attribute.name: size

attribute.description: When alloy:column is a child of alloy:dataTabe, this is the JavaBean property that is to be used for sorting.
attribute.name: sortBy

attribute.description: Indicates the sort order for the column. Valid values are ascending, descending, and none.
attribute.name: sortOrder

attribute.description: When alloy:column is a child of alloy:row, this is the width of this column as a unit from 1 to 12. This value is rendered as a CSS class as col-#{size}-#{span} (for example if span="4", the CSS class rendered will be col-#{size}-4). If both the width and span attributes are present, the width attribute determines the value of the span number. Please consider using width.
attribute.name: span

attribute.description: When alloy:column is a child of alloy:row, this is the width of the column as a percent. This value selects the span number via the formula span = (width/100)*12 (rounded to the nearest whole number). If both the width and span attributes are present, the width attribute determines the value of the span number.
attribute.name: width

tag.description: CommandButton is a UICommand component that renders a styleable HTML <button> element. The default type is submit. Since it extends HtmlCommandButton it supports all the features of h:commandButton. The component must be a child of h:form in order to trigger the action or actionListener.

attribute.description: A name for this component to be rendered to the user. This name should be localized for the user.
attribute.name: label

attribute.description: Javascript to execute after this component's value has changed, and then it loses focus.
attribute.name: onchange

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when the user selects this component.
attribute.name: onselect

attribute.description: When true, this causes an attribute to be rendered as readonly="readonly", and prevents the user from changing the value of this component.
attribute.name: readonly

attribute.description: The type of the button: button, submit (default), or reset.
attribute.name: type

tag.description: CommandLink is a UICommand component that renders an HTML <a> element. Since it extends HtmlCommandLink, it supports all the features of h:commandLink. The component must be a child of h:form in order to trigger the action or actionListener.
DataItem is a UIColumn component component that is designed to be used as a child of DataList and renders its children inside a <li> or <dt> element.
DataList is a UIData (iterator) component that renders <ul> (unordered), <ol> (ordered), or <dl> (description) lists.

attribute.description: The type of the list to render. Valid values are "unordered", "ordered" and "description".
attribute.name: type

tag.description: DataTable is a UIData (iterator) component that renders a <table> element representing tabular data and is designed to be used in conjunction with alloy:column child component tags. Since it extends HtmlDataTable, it supports all the features of h:dataTable.

attribute.description: The first row number that is to be displayed, relative to zero.
attribute.name: first

attribute.description: When true, multiple columns can be selected by the user when the meta key is held down during a left click on a sortable column header.
attribute.name: multiColumnSort

attribute.description: The total number of rows that are to be displayed. If not set, then all rows are displayed.
attribute.name: rows

attribute.description: Comma-delimited list of row indexes that indicate which rows are selected.
attribute.name: selectedRowIndexes

attribute.description: Indicates the type of row selection. Valid values are "checkbox", "radio".
attribute.name: selectionMode

tag.description: Dialog is a UIPanel component that that renders a <div> element that is initially styled with display:none so that it can be popped-up as an overlay by calling the JavaScript API. Since it extends HtmlPanelGroup, it supports all the features of h:panelGroup.

attribute.description: When true, the overlay window is automatically hidden when the user clicks outside of it.
attribute.name: dismissible

attribute.description: When true, the user must interact with the child dialog window before continuing to interact with the parent.
attribute.name: modal

tag.description: Field is a UIPanel component that renders a <div> element and a <label> element in order to wrap a field. Since it extends PanelGroup, it supports all the features of alloy:panelGroup.

attribute.description: The text value for the rendered <label> element.
attribute.name: label

attribute.description: When this flag is true, the label will be rendered before the rendered children.
attribute.name: labelFirst

attribute.description: Specifies whether the HTML element rendered by this component will be a div (default) or a span. If the value of this attribute is block, the rendered element will be a div.
attribute.name: layout

tag.description: Fieldset is a UIPanel component that renders a <fieldset> element in order to group form elements.

attribute.description: When this flag is true, the component will be disabled, and the user will be unable to interact with the component.
attribute.name: disabled

attribute.description: The text value for the rendered <legend> element.
attribute.name: legend

tag.description: Form is an HtmlForm component that delegates rendering to its JSF renderer.

attribute.description: HTML4 legacy passthrough attribute that has been made obsolete in HTML5 and is not supported by most browsers. The value can be a comma-delimited list of mime-types that the server accepts during file upload.
attribute.name: accept

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute (accept-charset) is a space-separated list of character encodings associated with form submission.
attribute.name: acceptcharset

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute that specifies how form-data should be encoded with form submission.
attribute.name: enctype

attribute.description: When this flag is true, view parameters (specified via f:viewParam tags) will be included in the URL rendered in the action attribute.
attribute.name: includeViewParams

attribute.description: When true, the form will prepend its id to child components.
attribute.name: prependId

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute that specifies the name of a tab/window/iframe that displays the results of the form submission.
attribute.name: target

tag.description: Head is a UIOutput that renders a <head> element for webapps, but not for portlets. In the case of portlets, the presence of alloy:head informs the JSF portlet bridge that JSF resources with target="head" should be included in the <head> element rendered by the portal. Since it extends HtmlHead, it supports all the features of h:head.
Icon is a component that renders a span which contains an icon specified by the name attribute.

attribute.description: The color of the icon which this component will render. Valid values include black (the default) and white.
attribute.name: color

attribute.description: The icon which this component will render. A list of valid icons can be found at Bootstrap Base CSS. Note: icon names must be specified without the glyphicon glyphicon- prefix.
attribute.name: name

tag.description: Image is a UIGraphic component that renders an img element. Since it extends HtmlGraphicImage, it supports all the features of h:graphicImage.

attribute.description: The height (in pixels) of the image.
attribute.name: height

attribute.description: When true, the image is part of a server-side image with clickable areas.
attribute.name: ismap

attribute.description: The library that contains the JSF image resource.
attribute.name: library

attribute.description: A URL linking to a page that contains a description of the image.
attribute.name: longdesc

attribute.description: The name of the JSF image resource.
attribute.name: name

attribute.description: An alias for the 'value' attribute.
attribute.name: url

attribute.description: Specifies the name or id of the map associated with the clickable areas of the image.
attribute.name: usemap

attribute.description: A context-relative path that can be used to retrieve the image.
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: The width (in pixels) of the image.
attribute.name: width

tag.description: InputDate is a UIInput component that renders an <input type="text"> element and a calendar-popover with selectable dates. The component attempts to automatically convert the submitted value to a Date via a built-in DateTimeConverter.

attribute.description: The maximum date that can be selected by the user. This attribute can be of type java.lang.String or java.util.Date.
attribute.name: maxDate

attribute.description: The minimum date that can be selected by the user. This attribute can be of type java.lang.String or java.util.Date.
attribute.name: minDate

attribute.description: The number of month panes shown in the popup calendar. Valid values are 1 (the default), 2, and 3.
attribute.name: panes

attribute.description: The format of the date that corresponds to patterns described in the javadoc for java.text.SimpleDateFormat.
attribute.name: pattern

attribute.description: When this flag is true, the component will hide when an item is selected. The default value is true.
attribute.name: autoHide

attribute.description: The key name that can be used to reference the component on the client.
attribute.name: clientKey

attribute.description: The locale of the component which can be of type java.lang.String or java.util.Locale.
attribute.name: locale

attribute.description: Specifies which event will pop up the picker. Valid values are "focus" (the default), "button", and "both".
attribute.name: showOn

attribute.description: The time zone of the component.
attribute.name: timeZone

attribute.description: Specifies the stack order of the component. The default value is a constant from the Liferay.zIndex JavaScript object.
attribute.name: zIndex

tag-extension.extends-tags: altInherited disabledInherited facesMessageLabelTaglibXMLOnly inputCommonInherited sizeInherited inputDateTimeCommon

tag.description: InputFile is a UIInput component that renders an <input> element with type=file. Since it extends HtmlInputFile, it supports all the features of h:inputFile and also supports multi-file uploads, instant-Ajax, preview, upload progress, and validation.

attribute.description: When this flag is true, selected files are appended to the preview table. Otherwise, the preview table is cleared when new files are selected. NOTE: This feature is only available when showProgress=true.
attribute.name: appendNewFiles

attribute.description: When this flag is true, files are uploaded automatically as soon as they are selected.
attribute.name: auto

attribute.description: Comma-delimited list of uploaded file MIME types that are valid. If not specified, then all MIME types are assumed to be valid.
attribute.name: contentTypes

attribute.description: A method that is executed when a file is uploaded. The method must be public, return void, and take a FileUploadEvent argument.
attribute.name: fileUploadListener

attribute.description: The absolute path that uploaded file should be copied to. If not specified, then the value of the <location> element specified in the Servlet 3.0 web.xml <multipart-config> of the FacesServlet <servlet> will be utilized. Otherwise, the value of the "com.liferay.faces.util.uploadedFilesDir" context-param is utilizied.
attribute.name: location

attribute.description: Maximum length (in bytes) permitted for each individual uploaded file. If not specified, then files of any length are assumed to be valid.
attribute.name: maxFileSize

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying whether or not multiple files can be uploaded. Valid values are blank (to upload a single file) or "multiple" (to upload multiple files).
attribute.name: multiple

attribute.description: When this flag is true, a table showing a preview will be rendered when the user selects one or more files.
attribute.name: showPreview

attribute.description: When this flag is true, a table showing file upload progress will be rendered when the user selects one of more files.
attribute.name: showProgress

tag.description: InputHidden is a UIInput component that renders an input element with type="hidden". Since it extends HtmlInputHidden, it supports all the features of h:inputHidden.
InputSecret is a UIInput component that renders an <input> element with type="password". Since it extends HtmlInputSecret, it supports all the features of h:inputSecret.

attribute.description: When true, the value attribute is rendered to the response. The default value is false for security purposes.
attribute.name: redisplay

tag.description: InputSourceCode is an input component that renders a field for editing source code text.

attribute.description: The the height (in pixels) of the rendered <div>.
attribute.name: height

attribute.description: When true, the background-color of the line that is being edited by the user (the active line) will change to indicate a highlight.
attribute.name: highlightActiveLine

attribute.description: The locale of the text that the editor is editing or displaying.
attribute.name: locale

attribute.description: Specifies the maximum number of lines that the editor is to display before a vertical scrollbar appears.
attribute.name: maxLines

attribute.description: Minimum number of lines that the editor is to display.
attribute.name: minLines

attribute.description: The name of the programming language that the editor is editing or displaying.
attribute.name: mode

attribute.description: When this flag is true, the component will be read-only, meaning that the user will be unable to edit the source code text. The default value is false.
attribute.name: readOnly

attribute.description: When this flag is true, a vertical line will appear that indicates the print margin. The default value is true.
attribute.name: showPrintMargin

attribute.description: The number of spaces that are to be displayed in place of each tab character.
attribute.name: tabSize

attribute.description: When this flag is true, the tab key will produce space characters rather than tab characters. The default value is false.
attribute.name: useSoftTabs

attribute.description: When this flag is true, the line will break when it reaches the end of the line. The default value is true.
attribute.name: useWrapMode

attribute.description: The value of this component, which is typically bound via EL to a model bean property.
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: The the width (in pixels) of the rendered <div>.
attribute.name: width

tag.description: InputText is a UIInput component that renders a field for editing single-line text. Since it extends HtmlInputText, it supports all the features of h:inputText.
InputTextarea is a UIInput component that renders a field for editing multi-line text. Since it extends HtmlInputTextarea, it supports all the features of h:inputTextarea.

attribute.description: The visible width of the text area.
attribute.name: cols

attribute.description: The number of lines in the text area.
attribute.name: rows

tag.description: InputTime is a UIInput component that renders an <input type="text"> element and a list-popover with selectable times. The component attempts to automatically convert the submitted value to a Date via a built-in DateTimeConverter.

attribute.description: When true, the first item in the list will be activated so that users can press TAB or ENTER to select it.
attribute.name: activateFirstItem

attribute.description: When true, the autoComplete list will wrap around allowing users to use keyboard navigation to move from the top of the list to the bottom and vice versa. The default value is true.
attribute.name: circular

attribute.description:
Specifies the type of filter that will be used for the pickTime's autocompletion. Valid values include:
  • charMatch
  • charMatchCase
  • phraseMatch
  • phraseMatchCase
  • startsWith
  • startsWithCase
  • subWordMatch
  • subWordMatchCase
  • wordMatch
  • wordMatchCase
attribute.name: filterType

attribute.description: The the height (in pixels) of the rendered autoComplete list.
attribute.name: height

attribute.description:
Specifies the type of filter that will be used for the pickTime's autocomplete highlighter. Valid values include:
  • charMatch
  • charMatchCase
  • phraseMatch
  • phraseMatchCase
  • startsWith
  • startsWithCase
  • subWordMatch
  • subWordMatchCase
  • wordMatch
  • wordMatchCase
attribute.name: highlighterType

attribute.description: The maximum amount of autoComplete results.
attribute.name: maxResults

attribute.description: The maximum time that can be selected by the user. maxTime can be of type java.lang.String (of the pattern "HH:mm:ss") or java.util.Date.
attribute.name: maxTime

attribute.description: The minimum time that can be selected by the user. minTime can be of type java.lang.String (of the pattern "HH:mm:ss") or java.util.Date.
attribute.name: minTime

attribute.description: When true, the component will render an HTML5 <input type="time" /> element on small/mobile displays in order to enable selection of a time with the mobile device's native UI.
attribute.name: nativeWhenMobile

attribute.description: The format of the time that corresponds to patterns described in the javadoc for java.text.SimpleDateFormat.
attribute.name: pattern

attribute.description: The delay in milliseconds before a query occurs. After the autoComplete receives input, it waits the specified number of milliseconds before querying it's source. If input occurs before the specified number of milliseconds has elapsed, the timer is reset.
attribute.name: queryDelay

attribute.description: When true, if the active option of the autoComplete is not in view, the view will be scrolled to make the active option is displayed to the user.
attribute.name: scrollIntoView

attribute.description: The step in seconds between each selectable timestamp. The default value is 3,600 seconds (or 1 hour).
attribute.name: step

tag.description: Link is a UIOutcomeTarget component that renders an <a> element (hyperlink). Since it extends HtmlLink, it supports all the features of h:link.

tag-extension.extends-tags: anchorLinkCommonInherited disabledInherited styleableInherited uiComponentBaseInherited uiOutcomeTargetInherited valueInherited

tag.description: LoadConstants is a TagHandler which can obtain constants from java for use in EL.

attribute.description: When true, the imported constants will be cached.
attribute.name: cacheable

attribute.description: The fully qualified name of the class, enum, or interface which the constants are being imported from.
attribute.name: classType

attribute.description: The name of the variable that is to be introduced into the EL representing the map of imported constants.
attribute.name: var

attribute.description: HTML5 passthrough attribute specifying whether the media will begin playing automatically.
attribute.name: autoplay

attribute.description: The content type of the media. This attribute is required when the value attribute is used to specify the media URL. Otherwise, the contentType defaults to to the content type determined by the JSF runtime for the resource.
attribute.name: contentType

attribute.description: HTML5 passthrough attribute specifying whether controls should be rendered for the media.
attribute.name: controls

attribute.description: When true the component will gracefully degrade to the Adobe® Flash® player for older browsers.
attribute.name: degrade

attribute.description: A context-relative path, resource URL, or FacesResource that can be used to retrieve the Adobe® Flash® player. The default flash player is the flash player bundled with AlloyUI. Note: The AlloyUI player does not support .ogv or .webm formats.
attribute.name: flashPlayer

attribute.description: The version of Adobe® Flash® required to play this media.
attribute.name: flashPlayerVersion

attribute.description: HTML5 passthrough attribute specifying whether the media will restart after it has completed playing.
attribute.name: loop

attribute.description: HTML5 passthrough attribute specifying whether the media will be muted initially.
attribute.name: muted

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a abort event occurs.
attribute.name: onabort

attribute.description: Javascript to execute after this component loses focus.
attribute.name: onblur

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a canplay event occurs.
attribute.name: oncanplay

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a canplaythrough event occurs.
attribute.name: oncanplaythrough

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a durationchange event occurs.
attribute.name: ondurationchange

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a emptied event occurs.
attribute.name: onemptied

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a ended event occurs.
attribute.name: onended

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a error event occurs.
attribute.name: onerror

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when this component gets focus.
attribute.name: onfocus

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a loadeddata event occurs.
attribute.name: onloadeddata

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a loadedmetadata event occurs.
attribute.name: onloadedmetadata

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a loadstart event occurs.
attribute.name: onloadstart

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a pause event occurs.
attribute.name: onpause

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a play event occurs.
attribute.name: onplay

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a playing event occurs.
attribute.name: onplaying

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a progress event occurs.
attribute.name: onprogress

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a ratechange event occurs.
attribute.name: onratechange

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a seeked event occurs.
attribute.name: onseeked

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a seeking event occurs.
attribute.name: onseeking

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a stalled event occurs.
attribute.name: onstalled

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a suspend event occurs.
attribute.name: onsuspend

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a timeupdate event occurs.
attribute.name: ontimeupdate

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a volumechange event occurs.
attribute.name: onvolumechange

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a waiting event occurs.
attribute.name: onwaiting

attribute.description: HTML5 passthrough attribute specifying how the media should be loaded in the page.
attribute.name: preload

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the css style of the element.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: A context-relative path, resource URL, FacesResource, or List<FacesResouce> that can be used to retrieve the media(s).
attribute.name: value

tag.description: A menu is a UIColumn component that renders nested/child tags as content within itself.

attribute.description: The visible label for the menu. This is only used if a facet with name="label" is not present.
attribute.name: label

tag.description: Message is a UIMessage component that renders a <span> element containing the text of a single FacesMessage for an associated component. Since it extends HtmlMessage, it supports all the features of h:message.

attribute.description: The id of the component for which to render an associated message.
attribute.name: for

tag.description: Messages is a UIMessages component that the text of one or more FacesMessage instances inside a <ul> element or <table> element for an associated component, according to the layout attribute. Since it extends HtmlMessages, it supports all the features of h:messages.

attribute.description: The id of the component for which to render associated message(s). This attribute takes precedence over the globalOnly attribute.
attribute.name: for

attribute.description: When true, only the global FacesMessages (those that are not associated with a specific component) are displayed.
attribute.name: globalOnly

attribute.description: When "table", an HTML table is rendered and each message appears in a separate table row. When "list", an HTML unordered list is rendered and each message appears in a separate list item.
attribute.name: layout

tag.description: OutputFormat is a UIOutput component that renders parameterized text. Since it extends HtmlOutputFormat, it supports all the features of h:outputFormat.
OutputLabel is a UIOutput component that renders its value attribute within a <label> element. Since it extends HtmlOutputLabel, it supports all the features of h:outputLabel.

attribute.description: The id of the target associated with this component.
attribute.name: for

tag.description: OutputLink is a UIOutput component that renders an <a> element (hyperlink). Since it extends HtmlOutputLink, it supports all the features of h:outputLink.
OutputRemainingChars is a UIOutput component that displays the number of characters remaining for an associated alloy:inputText or alloy:inputTextarea.

attribute.description: The id of the component for which the remaining characters are to be calculated.
attribute.name: for

attribute.description: The maximum number of charachters to allow in the input.
attribute.name: maxLength

attribute.description: Node or Selector to display the number of remaining characters calculated by the charCounter.
attribute.name: onceMaxlengthReached

attribute.description: Node or Selector to display the number of remaining characters calculated by the charCounter.
attribute.name: onMaxlengthReached

tag.description: OutputScript is a UIOutput component that renders a <script> element with type="text/javascript".

attribute.description: The position on the page where the JavaScript should be rendered. Valid values include body, form, and head. The default value of this attribute is an empty (null) value which causes the <script> to be rendered inline (corresponding to its position in the view). Specifying body for the target attribute will cause the <script> to be rendered as close to the closing body tag as possible.
attribute.name: target

attribute.description: A comma-delimited list of YUI or AlloyUI modules to load for this script. Note: if this attribute is specified, a YUI sandbox will be created automatically for the <script>.
attribute.name: use

tag.description: OutputStylesheet is a UIOutput component that renders a <style> element.

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the media type of the element.
attribute.name: media

tag.description: OutputText is an HtmlOutputText component that delegates rendering to its JSF renderer.

attribute.description: When false, markup will not be escaped.
attribute.name: escape

tag.description: OutputTooltip is a UIOutput component that renders a <div> element which is displayed as an overlay that is initially styled with display:none so that it can be popped-up as an overlay. Since it extends HtmlOutputText, it supports all the features of h:outputText.

attribute.description: The id of the component that is associated with the tooltip.
attribute.name: for

attribute.description: A number between 0 and 1 describing how much the tooltip will obscure its background when visible.
attribute.name: opacity

tag.description: Paginator is a UIComponent that renders pagination controls and can be used in conjunction with alloy:dataTable in order to paginate tabular data.

attribute.description: Space-delimited list of component ids that are to participate in the APPLY_REQUEST_VALUES, PROCESS_VALIDATIONS, UPDATE_MODEL_VALUES, and INVOKE_APPLICATION phases of the JSF lifecycle. The following keywords may also appear in the list: @this, @form, @all, @none. The default value is @this @for (meaning, the paginator itself and the associated alloy:dataTable).
attribute.name: execute

attribute.description: Integer representing the first page number that is to be displayed in the list of page number controls.
attribute.name: firstPage

attribute.description: The label of the control that causes the first page to be displayed. The default value is the "«" character code.
attribute.name: firstPageLabel

attribute.description: The id of the UIData component that is to be paginated.
attribute.name: for

attribute.description: The label of the control that causes the last page to be displayed. The default value is the "»" character code.
attribute.name: lastPageLabel

attribute.description: Integer representing the maximum number of page number controls that will be displayed.
attribute.name: maxPageNumberControls

attribute.description: The label of the control that causes the next page to be displayed. The default value is the "›" character code.
attribute.name: nextPageLabel

attribute.description: The label of the control that causes the previous page to be displayed. The default value is the "‹" character code.
attribute.name: previousPageLabel

attribute.description: Space-delimited list of component ids that are to participate in the RENDER_RESPONSE phase of the JSF lifecycle and be re-rendered in the DOM after the response is received from the XmlHttpRequest. The following keywords may also appear in the list: @this, @form, @all, @none, @for. The default value is @this @for (meaning, the paginator itself and the associated alloy:dataTable).
attribute.name: render

attribute.description: When true, a control will be rendered that will cause the associated UIData component to display the first page.
attribute.name: showFirstPageControl

attribute.description: When true, a control will be rendered that will cause the associated UIData component to display the last page.
attribute.name: showLastPageControl

attribute.description: When true, a control will be rendered that will cause the associated UIData component to display the next page.
attribute.name: showNextPageControl

attribute.description: When true, controls will be rendered for each page number (limited by the maxPageNumberControls attribute).
attribute.name: showPageNumberControls

attribute.description: When true, a control will be rendered that will cause the associated UIData component to display the previous page.
attribute.name: showPreviousPageControl

attribute.description: List of CSS class names (separated by spaces) that are to be rendered within the class attribute. Valid values are pagination-large, pagination-small, and pagination-mini.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description: Specifies the position of the row summary. The row summary will be displayed based on the results-x-x-of-x-page-x-of-x internationalized language key, for example: "Page 1 of 7."
attribute.name: summaryPosition

tag.description: Panel is a UIPanel component that renders a <div> element with three child <div> elements (one for header, body, and footer). Since it extends HtmlPanelGroup, it supports all the features of h:panelGroup.

attribute.description: The text to place in the footer of the component.
attribute.name: footerText

attribute.description: The text to place in the header of the component.
attribute.name: headerText

tag.description: PanelGrid is a UIPanel component that renders a <table> element to layout its children in a tabular grid. Since it extends HtmlPanelGrid, it supports all the features of h:panelGrid.

attribute.description: The total number of columns that are to be displayed. When the number of child components exceeds this number, the previous <tr> element is closed and a new <tr> element is opened.
attribute.name: columns

tag.description: PanelGroup is a UIPanel component that renders a <span> or a <div> element for grouping purposes. Since it extends HtmlPanelGroup, it supports all the features of h:panelGroup.

attribute.description: Specifies whether the HTML element rendered by this component will be a span (default) or a div. If the value of this attribute is "block", the rendered element will be a div.
attribute.name: layout

tag.description: Popover is a UIPanel component that that renders a <div> element that is initially styled with display:none so that it can be popped-up as an overlay by calling the JavaScript API. Since it extends HtmlPanelGroup, it supports all the features of h:panelGroup.

attribute.description: When true, the overlay window is automatically hidden when the user clicks outside of it.
attribute.name: dismissible

attribute.description: The id of the component that is associated with the popover.
attribute.name: for

tag.description:
ProgressBar is a UIComponent that displays a progress bar and can operate as a server-side or client-side progress indicator.

This component includes a client-side JavaScript API which can be accessed using the clientKey attribute and the Liferay.component() method:

  • set() - The set() method can be used to set the client-side value of the component e.g. Liferay.component('progressBar').set('value', value);.
  • start() - The start() method starts polling the server for the value of the component.
  • stop() - The stop() method stops the component's polling of the server.

attribute.description: The the height (in pixels) of the progress bar.
attribute.name: height

attribute.description: The label which appears on the progress bar. The {0} token can be used to include the value in the label.
attribute.name: label

attribute.description: The direction in which the layout of the component should be displayed. Valid values include lineDirection (the default) and pageDirection.
attribute.name: layout

attribute.description: The maximum value that the progress bar can have. The default value is 100.
attribute.name: maxProgress

attribute.description: The minimum value that the progress bar can have. The default value is 0.
attribute.name: minProgress

attribute.description: Client-side javascript to be executed when progress has completed.
attribute.name: oncomplete

attribute.description: The delay (in milliseconds) before dispatching a polling Ajax request after recieving the response of a previous request.
attribute.name: pollingDelay

attribute.description: The value of this component, which is typically bound via EL to a model bean property.
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: The the width (in pixels) of the progress bar.
attribute.name: width

tag.description: A generic resource tag for use with <alloy:audio> and <alloy:video>.

attribute.description: The content type of the resource.
attribute.name: contentType

attribute.description: The name of the library which contains the resource.
attribute.name: library

attribute.description: The name of the resource file to be included on the page.
attribute.name: name

tag.description: Row is a UIPanel component that renders a <div> and is designed to be used in conjunction with alloy:column child component tags.

SelectBooleanCheckbox is a UISelectOne component that renders a check box. Since it extends HtmlSelectBooleanCheckbox, it supports all the features of h:selectBooleanCheckbox such as accepting f:selectItem or f:selectItems as child tags.

SelectManyCheckbox is a UISelectMany component that renders checkboxes and enables the user to select multiple values. Since it extends HtmlSelectManyCheckbox, it supports all the features of h:selectManyCheckbox such as accepting f:selectItem or f:selectItems as child tags. However, since it does not render a <table>, it does not support h:selectManyCheckbox's border and layout attributes.

attribute.description: A CSS class name to apply to the label of each selected item.
attribute.name: selectedClass

attribute.description: A CSS class name to apply to the label of each unselected item.
attribute.name: unselectedClass

tag.description: SelectManyListbox is a UISelectMany component that renders a select element and enables the user to select multiple values. Since it extends HtmlSelectManyListbox, it supports all the features of h:selectManyListbox such as accepting f:selectItem or f:selectItems as child tags.

attribute.description: The number of items to show in the box. The default is to show all of the items.
attribute.name: size

tag.description: SelectManyMenu is a UISelectMany component that renders a select element and enables the user to select multiple values. It has the same basic features of alloy:selectManyListbox except that there is no size attribute because JSF "select*menu" components always render size=1. Since it extends HtmlSelectManyMenu, it supports all the features of h:selectManyMenu such as accepting f:selectItem or f:selectItems as child tags.

SelectOneListbox is a UISelectOne component that renders a `select` element (multi-item list) and enables the user to select one value. Since it extends HtmlSelectOneListbox, it supports all the features of h:selectOneListbox such as accepting f:selectItem or f:selectItems as child tags.

attribute.description: The number of items to show in the box. The default is to show all of the items.
attribute.name: size

tag.description: SelectOneMenu is a UISelectOne component that renders a select element (drop down list) and enables the user to select one value. Since it extends HtmlSelectOneMenu, it supports all the features of h:selectOneMenu such as accepting f:selectItem or f:selectItems as child tags.

SelectOneRadio is a UISelectOne component that renders radio buttons. Since it extends HtmlSelectOneRadio, it supports all the features of h:selectOneRadio such as accepting f:selectItem or f:selectItems as child tags. However, since it does not render a <table>, it does not support h:selectOneRadio's border and layout attributes.

attribute.description: The class name of the converter instance that is to be used by this component.
attribute.name: converter

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the language code used in the element.
attribute.name: lang

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the various WAI-ARIA roles that the element is used for.
attribute.name: role

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying where the element is located in the tabbing progression.
attribute.name: tabindex

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the title of the element.
attribute.name: title

tag.description: SelectStarRating is a UISelectOne component that renders a set of stars. The user can click on a star to select a rating and click on the same star a second time to de-select a rating. Since it extends HtmlSelectOneRadio, it accepts f:selectItem or f:selectItems as child tags.

SelectThumbRating is a UISelectOne component that renders a pair of thumb icons that a user can select to indicate their favor. The user can click on a thumb to select their favor and click on the same thumb a second time to de-select their favor. Since it extends HtmlSelectOneRadio, it accepts f:selectItem or f:selectItems as children.
Tab is a panel component that renders nested/child tags as content within itself.

attribute.description: When alloy:tab is a child of alloy:accordion, this is the name of the CSS class that is to be rendered within the class attribute of the content <div>
attribute.name: contentClass

attribute.description: When this flag is true, the component will be disabled, and the user will be unable to intercat with the component.
attribute.name: disabled

attribute.description: When alloy:tab is a child of alloy:accordion, this is the name of the CSS class that is to be rendered within the class attribute of the header <div>
attribute.name: headerClass

attribute.description: The text to place in the header of the component.
attribute.name: headerText

tag.description: TabView is an iterator component that renders tabs either statically or dynamically.

attribute.description: The the height (in pixels) of the rendered <div>.
attribute.name: height

attribute.description: Integer representing the zero-based index representing the selected tab.
attribute.name: selectedIndex

attribute.description: When true, this indicates whether or not the tabs will appear vertically. The default value is false.
attribute.name: stacked

attribute.description: The the height (in pixels) of the rendered <div>.
attribute.name: width

tag.description: Video is a UIComponent that renders a <div> that contains an HTML5 <video> element. It also supports graceful degradation for older browsers.

attribute.description: The height (in pixels) of the video, this attribute will also be applied to the Adobe® Flash® player's <object> tag.
attribute.name: height

attribute.description: A context-relative path, resource URL, or FacesResource that can be used to retrieve the poster image.
attribute.name: poster

attribute.description: The width (in pixels) of the video, this attribute will also be applied to the Adobe® Flash® player's <object> tag.
attribute.name: width
